intro: Psychotria euneura, commonly known as the "Cocaine plant," is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant is notable for containing alkaloids, including cocaine, which is extracted from its leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its psychoactive properties, it is both economically and ecologically significant in its native habitat.
